meanings.definition: Of or relating to the outer layer of cells in an embryo.
meanings.sent1: The epiblastic cells form the outer layer of the embryo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the epiblastic layer to understand embryo development.
meanings.sent3: The epiblastic cells in the embryo like to be on the outside, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like epiblastic cells, covering her ideas with a protective layer.
meanings.sent5: The epiblastic layer shields the delicate inner cells, like a guardian armor.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the outermost layer of tissue in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The epiblastic tissue protects the outer layer of the organism.
meanings.sent2: An injury to the epiblastic layer can affect the organism's health.
meanings.sent3: The epiblastic covering on the organism acts like a cozy blanket, keeping it warm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an epiblastic shield, guarding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The epiblastic tissue acts as a shield, defending the organism from harm.

meanings.definition: Originating from or located on the outer surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The epiblastic growth on the tree was a sign of its health.
meanings.sent2: The epiblastic layer on the skin protects it from external factors.
meanings.sent3: The epiblastic layer on the cake was the tastiest part, according to the kids.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were like epiblastic decorations, adding charm to the party.
meanings.sent5: The epiblastic layer on the building shielded it from the harsh weather.
